metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14745 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
The *_get_synthetic_symtab functions in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD)library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29, interpret a -1value as a sorting count instead of an error flag, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (integer overflow and applicationcrash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted ELF file,related to elf32-i386.c and elf64-x86-64.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14745` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-common - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-for-build - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-for-host - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1

binutils-i686-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-i686-linux-gnu - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1

binutils-mips64el-linux-gnuabin32 - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-mipsel-linux-gnu - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-mipsisa32r6-linux-gnu - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-mipsisa32r6el-linux-gnu - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-mipsisa64r6-linux-gnuabi64 - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-mipsisa64r6-linux-gnuabin32 - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-mipsisa64r6el-linux-gnuabi64 - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-mipsisa64r6el-linux-gnuabin32 - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-multiarch - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnuspe - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1

binutils-riscv64-linux-gnu - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1

binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnux32 - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
libbinutils - 2.29.1-1ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: binutils package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.29.1-1ubuntu1').
